result.execSummary:
The defendant Breion X Owten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing November 1, 2015 or penalty of 3 days Huber for non-payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must petition the court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breion X Owten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Breion X Owten in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #3 of the amended charge.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #3.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Attorney Redetzke moves for possible expunction in the future.  

The Court Orders the Following to count #3:

FINE: $ 473.50
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  
Total amounts due to be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing 11/1/2015 .  Failure to pay; the Court orders alternate sentence of 3 days Huber.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Defendant Breion X Owten in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Breion X Owten in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Breion X Owten in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Breion X Owten in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not eligible for the public defender and is requesting the court to appoint counsel. Court grants the request and the defendant is to reimburse the county at the rate of $50.00 a month commencing 06/30/2015 and every month thereafter. Time limits are tolled.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Breion X Owten in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is seeking a private attorney, or has the papers for a court appointed attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with  co defendant victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processin  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Breion X Owten in court in custody with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.  Attorney appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant was provided with application for Court Appointed Attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
